sub_title: OneTrust Fellow of Privacy Technology | Legal Consultant | IP Enthusiast | Techno-Legal Writer | Chess Player
summary:
In my role as a legal consultant working at Considerati, Amsterdam, I have consistently engaged with the GDPR. This experience has provided me with an opportunity to also enthusiastically delve into dynamic European laws of the ‘digital decade’, such as the Artificial Intelligence Act and the Digital Services Act. 

With technology changing how we work, nearly a quarter of a lawyer's work can apparently be automated. However, I believe that instead of replacing us, technology will help us augment our professional skills, increase efficiency and allow us to concentrate on value addition. 

Prior to graduating from an Advanced Master’s in Law and Digital Technologies from Leiden University with Honours, I did a semester abroad at University College Cork, participated in various international conferences and seminars, drafted multiple techno-legal papers/blogs, and interned and worked at premier Indian law firms specialising in IPR and information technology. 

As Bar-qualified lawyer in India with a Bachelors in Arts and Law (Hons.), and a Post-Graduate Diploma in Cyber Law and Cyber Forensics, I have always been passionate about all things law, data protection and privacy, and intellectual property. I have always been passionate about law as it provides insight into various fields and is empowering to use as a tool for social change. To that end, I am an advocate of proactive regulation to leverage the inevitable digital disruption in our sphere to maximise benefit and to provide better legal services. 

I am supported by my agility, strategic vision, adaptability, and a constant drive to learn; traits that are vital in a rapidly evolving industry. My approach is further underpinned by hard work, dedication, a commitment to integrity, and a receptiveness to feedback. 

When I am not thinking like a lawyer, you can find me playing chess, reading, travelling,  playing badminton, or simply bantering in English, Kannada, Hindi or German.

If you share my optimism and want to collaborate, or if you disagree and want to debate, this is the forum to contact me.

profile_positions.description:
As a Legal Consultant in Privacy and Data Protection, I have the following responsibilities:

Drafting privacy advice on topics such as Cookies, Data Transfers, Data Clean Rooms, Google Signals etc. 
Conducting Cookie Scans on client websites
Contributing to PbD, PETs and AI Risk Management Frameworks 
Drafting specific Privacy Policies, such as Data Subject Rights Policy, Data Retention Policy, Cookie Policy etc. 
Reviewing DPIA, DPA and DCA Templates, and other Security/Privacy Documentation
Developing "New Products" on the EU AI Act and Digital Services Act
Drafting Proposals and Engagement Letters 
Conducting a DPIA and aiding in setting up a Register of Processing Activities
profile_positions.title: Legal Consultant

profile_positions.description: As an IP Litigation Associate, my job responsibilities included drafting and filing IP commercial suits, appeals and writs, and documents, coordinating and communicating with clients and court personnel, drafting opinions and emails, conducting research, including of case laws, briefing seniors, arguing and external counsels, and preparing for and attending hearings at the Hon'ble Delhi High Court.
profile_positions.title: IP Litigation Associate

profile_positions.description:
Handling Intellectual Property, Cyberlaw and Data Protection related advisory, litigation and consultation at the High Court of Delhi, and the Supreme Court of India.

To that effect, I conducted webinars, wrote papers, conducted research, among other responsibilities.
profile_positions.title: Legal Associate

profile_positions.description:
I undertook the following tasks:

-Collating and Creating Questions on GDPR to use on Flash Cards
-Creating a Write-up on Model Contract Clauses w.r.t Google's Implementation in Sub-Processing Agreements
-Creating Data Protection Principles and Data Subject Rights Handling Checklists
-Researching case-laws on the validity of assignment of Trademark over Registration
-Making a case brief on Patents
-Creating a Data Subject Rights Addressal Exceptions Table
-Updating the Newsletter on Data Protection Developments
-Researching on BS 10,012 Certification and its integration of GDPR Compliance Requirements and on the Irish Data Protection Authority's stance on Facebook merging its subsidiaries with itself
-Analysing Google's purported legal position vis-a-vis Publishers under the General Data Protection Regulation
-Creating a write-up on Consent Management Platforms and their efforts to build a GDPR Compliant Framework, especially with regards to Buzzfeed
-Researching on different overlapping characters w.r.t Data Protection Legislations, especially PDPB's compliance with the same 
-Corresponding with Product Dossier to decide the nature of processing to see if a DPIA is required
-Researching on Article 3(2) to figure out what kind of cookie use translates to monitoring of EU User Behaviour
profile_positions.title: Legal Intern

profile_positions.description:
I undertook the following tasks:

-Reading and making notes on case files Needle Industries vs. Parveen Kumar
-Creating a timeline of events and dates of the case
-Drafting the Injunction Application for Valvoline
-Creating a Company Profile and conducting a Trademark Search for Besins Healthcare
-Researching Judgements by Valmiki Mehta on trademark Infringement Matters
-Researching on Transfer of Shares between non-resident Indians
-Looking up Compatibility Claims on Amazon's listings with regards to Hasbro's Nerf TM
-Researching Case-Laws on Misjoinder of Parties
-Collating Judgement Summaries
-Expanding Country Abbreviations under WIPO
-Creating Case Notes for United Spirit Ltd. vs. John Distilleries
-Briefing Junior Counsel on Case Matters
-Researching Liquidator's Powers under Companies Act, 2013 and IBC
-Researching on the Stamp Duty requirement for a Letter of Intent (LOI) and on Employee Compensation Act and allied Rules
-Conducting and assisting in an Import/Export Exercise through the application of FEMA, RBI Master Circulars, Customs Act and Rules
profile_positions.title: Trademark Litigation Intern

profile_positions.description:
I undertook the following tasks:

-Drafting a course on General Data Protection Regulation for an e-learning website to highlight compliance requirements by making presentations and quizzes covering Jurisdictional Aspects, Definitions, Data Protection Principles, Data Subject Rights, Purposes for Processing, Model Transfer Clauses, Regulatory Authorities and Punishments.
-Undertaking a GAP Analysis that included Data Protection Impact Assessments and Legitimate Interest Assessments, 
-Researching Data Protection Case-Laws in Europe, Canada and Australia and the penalties imposed by Regulatory Authorities
-Creating info-graphics comparing different Data Protection Legislations to the Personal Data Protection Bill, 2019 in India and the penalties thereunder
-Writing an article on the nexus between Customs and Trademark Law.
profile_positions.title: Legal Intern

profile_positions.description:
As an impassioned volunteer, I contributed to enclosure enrichment such as cleaning the enclosures and building structures for the same and maintenance including cutting fruits and vegetables for the animals, corporate and school outreach awareness campaigns, and animal rescue and release. 

Over the course of a month, Wildlife Conservation Drives were organized with Little Flower Public School and Shantinikethan Public School to raise awareness and help raise monetary and in kind donations.
profile_positions.title: Volunteer

-Reviewing other drafts
-Researching the state of Patents and Trademark in India and abroad

-Creating a timeline for the Patent Process in India, post 2017, including the documents required during the Patent Application Process
profile_positions.title: Intellectual Property Intern

profile_positions.description:
I undertook the following tasks in an effort to assist the In-House Counsel:

-Researching case laws and jurisprudential principles on Joint-Venture Agreements
-Creating briefs on the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code, 2016
-Comparison between foreign and domestic principles for pricing under Competition Law
-Understanding the legality of certain competitive practices
-Perusing over the GST Act to note the updated tax aspect of leasing
-Analysing Insider Trading Regulations of SEBI considering relevant case laws
-Researching certain sections of CPC to view it in the backdrop of transactions involving immovable property
-Studying relevant sections of the Sexual Harassment of Women Act, 2013 to understand the constitution of the Internal Complaints Committee 
-Compiling a short-note on Convertible Notes in lights of FEMA regulations and Company Rules
-Researching case-laws establishing that perpetual negative covenants are in violation of trade and contract law in Australia, USA and India
-Understanding the nature of confidentiality in perpetual agreements
-Analysing domestic transfer pricing under the Income Tax Act, 1961
-Understanding the nuances of contract negotiation to draft an iron-clad agreement

volunteer_experiences.description: Volunteers are required to help with old people, spend time with them and strive to give them a sense of comfort that a family member would give them.

Being a part of this esteemed, international organization allowed us to collect over 10,000 books, over the course of a year and help build libraries in Mongolia. Furthermore, repeated literacy awareness campaigns also saw my participation.
My role in CARE involved raising money by opening stalls in the Christmas Market, conducting donation drives and organising Valentines' Day exchanges.

Being a volunteer for this crippled shelter helped not only the animals, who were in dire need of care, but also us, because it exposed us to field work, like building fences and cleaning their cages, and to the workings of a not-for-profit organisation.
